page.title: 06ASTWOOD BANK HOUSES
page.content: Edgoake Lane is a lovely old fashioned road just off the main road,it consists of many attractive houses but,the main attraction must be an old black and white building called 'Greensleeves'.At the front of the house is a beautiful lawn with saddle stones surrounding it and on the inside of the lawn is a wooden wheelbarrow with many flowers planted in it.Being a 15th century building it does need slight repairs done to it, but is quite well preserved for its age.This house has many little attatchments which might not catch your eye at first glance,like on the door is a large iron chain which rings the bell and just below that is an 18th century pump which used to pump water for villagers.Other details that are around the house are a well and a small building for the gardeners.
